required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Photographic Library of Moderate to Severe Psoriasis Subjects Treated With Infliximab (Study P05047)
clinical_study.official_title: Atlas of the Evolution of Psoriasis Lesions Under RemicadeÂ® : A Dynamic Standardized Photographic Library of Moderate to Severe Psoriasis Subjects Treated With Infliximab

brief_summary.textblock: This is a national, multi-center, observational, prospective photographic atlas study in subjects who are treated with infliximab for moderate-to-severe psoriasis in daily clinic according to local country regulations and reimbursement.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects will enter this study using a non-probability sampling method.

primary_outcome.measure: Static Photographic Physician Global Assessment (PGA) Score as Assessed by Two Dermatologists
primary_outcome.time_frame: Week 0 (Visit 1), Week 2 (Visit 2), Week 6 (Visit 3), Week 14 (Visit 4), Week 22 (Visit 5), Week 30 (Visit 6)
primary_outcome.description: Digital pictures of each participant's whole body were taken at each visit. Static PGA was assessed by two dermatologists on the basis of these pictures at a single point in time. The mean of the two readings from the dermatologists was used. Static PGA score ranged from 0 (no psoriasis) to 5 (extreme psoriasis). The higher the number, the more severe the psoriasis was.

primary_outcome.measure: Dynamic Photographic PGA Score as Assessed by Two Dermatologists
primary_outcome.description: The dynamic PGA score resulted from the comparison of two sets of pictures/visits. The dynamic PGA was scored twice, at the middle and at the end of the observation period (comparison between picture sets of Week 0 (Visit 1) and Week 14 (Visit 4) visits and comparison between picture sets of Week 0 (Visit 1) and Week 30 (Visit 6) visits. Dynamic PGA was assessed by two dermatologists and the mean of the two readings was used. Clinical improvement was measured with a 10 centimeter (cm)-visual analogue scale (VAS) ranging from 0 (no improvement) to 10 (disappearance of lesions).

secondary_outcome.measure: Static PGA Score as Assessed by the Investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 0 (Visit 1), Week 2 (Visit 2), Week 6 (Visit 3), Week 14 (Visit 4), Week 22 (Visit 5), Week 30 (Visit 6)
secondary_outcome.description: Static PGA was assessed at each visit by the investigator. Static PGA score ranged from 0 (no psoriasis) to 5 (extreme psoriasis). The higher the number, the more severe the psoriasis was.

secondary_outcome.measure: Dynamic PGA Score as Assessed by the Investigator
secondary_outcome.description: The dynamic PGA was scored twice, at the middle and at the end of the observation period. Clinical improvement from Baseline (Visit 1) was evaluated with a 10 cm-VAS ranging from 0 (no improvement) to 10 (disappearance of lesions) at the Week 14 (Visit 4) and Week 30 (Visit 6) visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Body Surface Area (BSA) Involved With Psoriasis
Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI) Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 0 (Visit 1), Week 2 (Visit 2), Week 6 (Visit 3), Week 14 (Visit 4), Week 22 (Visit 5), Week 30 (Visit 6)
secondary_outcome.description: PASI ranged from 0 (no symptoms) to 72 (very marked symptoms) and assessed 3 clinical signs within each area (head, arms, trunk, and legs): erythema (redness), induration (thickness), and desquamation (scaling).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 0 (Visit 1), Week 2 (Visit 2), Week 6 (Visit 3), Week 14 (Visit 4), Week 22 (Visit 5), Week 30 (Visit 6)
secondary_outcome.description: The nail was divided with imaginary horizontal and longitudinal lines into quadrants. Each nail was given a score for nail bed psoriasis (0-4) and nail matrix psoriasis (0-4) depending on the presence of any of the features of nail psoriasis in that quadrant. Each nail was evaluated, and the sum of all the nails was the total NAPSI score. The sum of the scores from all nails ranged from 0 (no psoriasis) to 80 (psoriasis present in all 4 quadrants of all 10 nails).

secondary_outcome.measure: Static PGA Score as Assessed by the Participant
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 0 (Visit 1), Week 2 (Visit 2), Week 6 (Visit 3), Week 14 (Visit 4), Week 22 (Visit 5), Week 30 (Visit 6)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants assessed their psoriasis at Week 0 (Visit 1), Week 2 (Visit 2), Week 6 (Visit 3), Week 14 (Visit 4), Week 22 (Visit 5), and Week 30 (Visit 6) according to the Static PGA score, which ranged from 0 (no psoriasis) to 5 (extreme psoriasis). The higher the number, the more severe the psoriasis was.

secondary_outcome.measure: Dynamic PGA Score as Assessed by the Participant
secondary_outcome.description: The dynamic PGA was scored twice, at the middle and at the end of the observation period. Clinical improvement from Baseline (Visit 1) was evaluated with a 10 cm-VAS ranging from 0 (no improvement) to 10 (disappearance of lesions) at the Week 14 (Visit 4) and Week 30 (Visit 6) visits.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 0 (Visit 1), Week 2 (Visit 2), Week 6 (Visit 3), Week 14 (Visit 4), Week 22 (Visit 5), Week 30 (Visit 6)
secondary_outcome.description: DLQI ranged from 0 (no effect on participant's life) to 30 (extremely large effect on participant's life) and was computed by summing the score (each ranging from 0 to 3) of each of a 10-item questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Satisfactory Health Status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 0 (Visit 1), Week 2 (Visit 2), Week 6 (Visit 3), Week 14 (Visit 4), Week 22 (Visit 5), Week 30 (Visit 6)
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's opinion on his/her health status, as assessed by the following question: "Think about all the ways your psoriasis is affecting you, do you consider that your current status is satisfactory? (Yes/No)"

arm_group.description: Subjects with moderate-to-severe psoriasis who are treated with infliximab in daily clinics according to local country regulations and reimbursements.

study_pop.textblock: Participation to the observational study will be proposed to Dermatology departments by the medical department of the sponsor. Subjects with moderate-to-severe psoriasis initiating infliximab in accordance with the terms of the European label will be asked to participate.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female, age >=18 with moderate-to-severe psoriasis.
- Patient for whom the physician has decided to initiate psoriasis treatment with infliximab in accordance with the terms of the European labeling.
- Patient must demonstrate his/her willingness to participate in the observational study by signing a written consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient unable to understand and answer a self administered questionnaire.
- No specific non-inclusion criteria will be applied to eligible patients.
- Contradiction and/or Precaution listed in the Summary of Product Characteristics.

group.title: Infliximab
group.description: Participants with moderate-to-severe psoriasis initiating infliximab in accordance with the terms of the European label were asked to participate in this observational study.

participants_list.participants: Nine participants were excluded because they did not fulfill the inclusion criteria.

outcome.title: Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI) Score
outcome.description: PASI ranged from 0 (no symptoms) to 72 (very marked symptoms) and assessed 3 clinical signs within each area (head, arms, trunk, and legs): erythema (redness), induration (thickness), and desquamation (scaling).

measure.title: Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI) Score
measure.description: PASI ranged from 0 (no symptoms) to 72 (very marked symptoms) and assessed 3 clinical signs within each area (head, arms, trunk, and legs): erythema (redness), induration (thickness), and desquamation (scaling).

outcome.title: Nail Psoriasis Severity Index (NAPSI) Score
outcome.description: The nail was divided with imaginary horizontal and longitudinal lines into quadrants. Each nail was given a score for nail bed psoriasis (0-4) and nail matrix psoriasis (0-4) depending on the presence of any of the features of nail psoriasis in that quadrant. Each nail was evaluated, and the sum of all the nails was the total NAPSI score. The sum of the scores from all nails ranged from 0 (no psoriasis) to 80 (psoriasis present in all 4 quadrants of all 10 nails).
outcome.time_frame: Week 0 (Visit 1), Week 2 (Visit 2), Week 6 (Visit 3), Week 14 (Visit 4), Week 22 (Visit 5), Week 30 (Visit 6)

measure.title: Nail Psoriasis Severity Index (NAPSI) Score
measure.description: The nail was divided with imaginary horizontal and longitudinal lines into quadrants. Each nail was given a score for nail bed psoriasis (0-4) and nail matrix psoriasis (0-4) depending on the presence of any of the features of nail psoriasis in that quadrant. Each nail was evaluated, and the sum of all the nails was the total NAPSI score. The sum of the scores from all nails ranged from 0 (no psoriasis) to 80 (psoriasis present in all 4 quadrants of all 10 nails).

outcome.title: Static PGA Score as Assessed by the Participant
outcome.description: Participants assessed their psoriasis at Week 0 (Visit 1), Week 2 (Visit 2), Week 6 (Visit 3), Week 14 (Visit 4), Week 22 (Visit 5), and Week 30 (Visit 6) according to the Static PGA score, which ranged from 0 (no psoriasis) to 5 (extreme psoriasis). The higher the number, the more severe the psoriasis was.
outcome.time_frame: Week 0 (Visit 1), Week 2 (Visit 2), Week 6 (Visit 3), Week 14 (Visit 4), Week 22 (Visit 5), Week 30 (Visit 6)

outcome.description: The dynamic PGA was scored twice, at the middle and at the end of the observation period. outcome.title: Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI) Score
outcome.description: DLQI ranged from 0 (no effect on participant's life) to 30 (extremely large effect on participant's life) and was computed by summing the score (each ranging from 0 to 3) of each of a 10-item questionnaire.
outcome.time_frame: Week 0 (Visit 1), Week 2 (Visit 2), Week 6 (Visit 3), Week 14 (Visit 4), Week 22 (Visit 5), Week 30 (Visit 6)

reported_events.desc: All 133 participants enrolled in the study were included in the safety population.

group.title: Infliximab
group.description: Participants with moderate-to-severe psoriasis initiating infliximab in accordance with the terms of the European label were asked to participate in this observational study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Prior to publication or presentation (abstract, poster, oral communication and any other support existing or future), a copy of the final text should be forwarded by the Investigator(s) to the sponsor, for comment and authorization. Such comments and authorization shall aim to ensure the scientific content of the proposed publication and/or presentations and shall ensure that data and the material referring to the sponsor activities receive fair, accurate, and reasonable presentation.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
